did.unittitle: David A. Bentzin expert witness files
did.abstract: This collection consists of David Bentzin’s copies of reports, files, and documents related to Docket 279-D of the Indian Claims Commission case of the Blackfeet Tribe of Montana vs. The United States of America in the 1970s. Bentzin acted as an expert witness for the Blackfeet Tribe in his capacity as a petroleum exploration geologist.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: David Bentzin earned his Master of Science degree in Geology from the University of Montana in 1960. Upon graduation, Bentzin moved to Casper, Wyoming, where he worked as a geologist for petroleum companies. In 1975, the Blackfeet Tribe of Montana brought suit against the United States alleging that the government was deficient in its management of the tribe’s oil and gas resources. The tribe believed that the United States government had permitted the allotment of the Blackfeet Reservation to individual Native Americans without reservation of the mineral estate to the Blackfeet tribe. The tribe also alleged that the federal government had discouraged development of Blackfeet oil and gas revenues and that the government had drained oil and gas from tribal lands to non-tribal lands. David Bentzin was presented as an expert witness for the Blackfeet Tribe in his capacity as a petroleum geologist. Bentzin developed a case for the Blackfeet based on the uneven oil and gas development of the Blackfeet portion of the Cutbank Oil field by the Bureau of Indian Affairs relative to the development authorized by the Bureau of Land Management on adjacent, non-tribal parcels. The Blackfeet Tribe was eventually awarded $5 million in damages by the United States Government.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of David Bentzin’s copies of reports, files, and documents related to Docket 279-D of the Indian Claims Commission case of the Blackfeet Tribe of Montana vs. The United States of America in the 1970s. Bentzin acted as an expert witness for the Blackfeet Tribe in his capacity as a petroleum exploration geologist. Researchers will find Bentzin’s annotations on a few reports.

arrangement.p: This collection has been maintained in original order.

acqinfo.p: This collection was donated to the Archives by David Bentzin in 2008.

processinfo.p: The collection was kept in original order and no series divisions were imposed upon the collection. The materials were kept in their original folders or binders except when no housing existed and in those cases, materials were refoldered. Materials were then moved to acid-free boxes.

relatedmaterial.p: Montana State University-Bozeman Special Collections holds the Thomas R. Wessel Indian Claims Commission Research Papers consisting of photocopies of research reports and records from the Bureau of Indian Affairs and Department of the Interior, Indian Division gathered for Docket 279-D.
